Reviews.Title: “Schmick hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poshladdie
Reviews.Content: If you take a punt on this hotel you are guaranteed to win. Great new hotel that opened in Nov 11 at Darling Harbour. Entrance via casino or Ultimo side. We were given a great welcome from Peter at reception who was professional and seamless. Peter ensured a very smooth check-in and that our needs were met. Very impressive. The room we had was modern and hip. Sony iphone player/charger, huge tv with a remote that opened the curtains, changed the air-con temp and so on. Bed,linen and pillows were divine. Slept like a baby. ( I am a bad sleeper ) Toiletries superb. Lots of dining options at The Star and a Coles across the road in Pyrmont Street. The Darling is a winner. We stayed here as part of a Prancing Horse Ferrari Ultimate Drive weekend which is a MUST

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally good hotel”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for a friend's birthday. Upon check in, I was so impressed, the service was amazing. Once I had checked in, the lady at the front desk immediately escorted me to my room. I was surprised and I did not expect this extra service. The room looked amazing. The decor was very modern. The room had a nice big flat screen television and two comfortable beds. The bathroom was stocked with Molton Brown toiletries and accessories. The only thing I did not like about the bathroom, was there was not much privacy between the bedroom and the bathroom. There was only a wall in the middle of the bathroom, which separated the bedroom from the bathroom. This can be awkward if you need privacy. We were lucky enough to be offered a bottle of champagne and strawberries, because it was my friend's birthday. The beds in our room were very comfortable. The sheets were very soft. The room could be accessed via remote. For example if you wanted to close the blinds, turn on the television of turn off the lights, you can do so by remote. The hotel also offers robes and slippers too. I was very impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “freebie”
Reviews.Author: TonyD62
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights as a supplier freebie. very comfortable but no where in the fridge to put milk because all the drinks are rigged to a "you move em you pay for em" electronic system No free wifi - at this price are you kidding ?

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey”
Reviews.Author: joanWellington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Darling for 2 nights recently. The hotel is new and caters for the casino crowd. The room was lovely and there were buttons for everything which was a bit confusing. The bedding was clean and very good quality but we needed to remove the under quilt as the bed was so soft. Our room had a faulty coffee machine and no kettle but a kettle was brought up in 20 mins when asked. The hotel pool was lovely and I used it once as we were a bit unlucky to find the pool closed the afternoon we were there due to a photo shoot. There were only upmarket eateries in the hotel but plenty of places within walking distance. The location was good for darling harbour but I would stay on the city side for shopping etc as it is a 15-20 min walk into the city. The bell boys were lovely and polite as were the reception staff. This is a nice hotel but not really value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt luxury”
Reviews.Author: dollyddraws
Reviews.Content: A beautiful new hotel in darling Harbour , very trendy and classy with beautifully furnished rooms. We had a junior suite with water views, a gorgeous spa bath huge walk in closet and a bed that was soooooo comfortable. We left the room to go to dinner but wanted to hurry back to enjoy the suite. Breakfast was ordered delivered to the room, it was on time, hot and better than expected. Fantastic. The darling doesn't skimp an the extras .. Nespresso cover maker in the room, molton brown amenities, dental and shaving kits. Would love to escape there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, but part of The Star complex..”
Reviews.Author: Bondigirl
Reviews.Content: I had one night here in a Jewel suite. I chose this hotel as it was located near to an event I was attending, and for that it was a good choice. For me service can really make a hotel / restaurant special. Service here was excellent - from the concierge to housekeeping. There are lots of small touches that really enhanced the overall experience - from the design, music, scent (yes, the candles are gorgeous & in the spa they even pump a special blend through the air con system - great attention to detail). Room: jewel suite - separate living area with great curved sofa, lounging chairs, nespresso machine, huge tv (you could have quite a party in here!) then generously sized bedroom. Bathroom with bath & shower. Molton Brown products. Sokyo is the hotel restaurant which is great. Moodily lit, great cocktails & Japanese food. Negatives - there isn't a restaurant within the hotel open for breakfast, which is annoying. You can get room service breakfast & The Darling is also right next to (almost part of) The Star casino complex, and within that complex Bistro 80 serves breakfast. But who wants to walk past gaming floors & what feels like a slightly tacky mall to get to breakfast? Positives - the spa. Sensational. Beats The Observatory Spa. You feel absolutely cocooned here. It smells divine! You are greeted with fresh orange juice, then once changed have tea on supremely comfortable reclining loungers (artfully designed). The spa is moodily lit, & very calming. I had the hamam treatment, which was good - although I could have done with the temperature being warmer. Pool - great to have an outdoor pool & chairs to chill out at. Would I stay again? If I had an event nearby yes, if I had a night out at The Lyric Theatre or was dining at Balla or Black & wanted a night away. But just be aware that it's really part of The Star casino complex, and that's not everyone's idea of fun. But it would be great for a girls' weekend, or a night with significant other if you're foodies & are going to Balla or Momofuku or something..... Pool & spa are really worth enjoying too.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Sydney if you want to feel pampered ^^”
Reviews.Author: Eric H
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Sydney if you want to feel pampered ^^ you even have your own nesspresso machine I'm your room. All the toliette are Molton Brown. everything can be control by a romote control. Saying like room lights from bright to middle todatk, blind curtains, room temperature and etc. Its simply the best. Room service are prompt and the turn down service is the best. Free loccatane hand cream and spray. This is simply the best value hotel in Sydney if you want to be pampered. Location is very good too. Me and my wife always goes to this hotel fo aa romantic weekend and nice restaurant there. Simply out it your mind would be blown away. Two thumbs and two toes up ;)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Bibbstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend away and thought we would treat ourselves to something nice.Â  We stayed in The Darling Room. (at $380 a night) On arrival we were greeted at our car with our doors beingÂ opened for us, impressed at this stage, our luggage was retrieved from boot of car (valet parking well worth it $26) luggage wheeled to concierge front desk where our name was taken, weÂ then checked in at reception, once finishedÂ we were ushered to our room and shown the facilities of the room and our bag was there. We selected a complimentary paper, it was only delivered the first one morning. :( The first morning we went out for breakfast on Darling Harbour about 10am then did some site seeing, we got back to room around 3pm and room service had not been, we had thought The Darling didn't do daily room service, our door bell rang at 345pm and it was room service wanting to make up the room I declined the offer as we knew we were going to have a late night n wanted to have an afternoon nap, however the young gentleman proceeded to enter room n change towels. We had our nap and got up to start getting ready for our night out, my partner went down stairs while I was getting ready, the door bell rang, I just got out of shower and stood there hoping they would go away then it rang again and the young gentleman then proceeded to walk in asking if I wanted a fold down service, I told him no thanks and asked him to leave, he then proceeded to walk out and walk back in and leave the complimentary water and chocolates on bathroom sink, this service only happened on second night.Â  Overall facilities n staff were great, staff always greeting you, use the room privacy button if you don't want any disruptions. The coffee machine in room was great but no where to put milk in fridge as all items are sensored.Â  Shower is great, bed is so comfortable.Â  I would stay again, maybe for our anniversary as my partner proposed on our second night and made the weekend so special.Â

Reviews.Title: “a resort style break in the city”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to find out what all the fuss was about - did Sydney's first new five star hotel in 10 years really live up to the hype? And the answer... well wait until the end of the review :-) First impressions were excellent - the atrium-style lobby area was impressive, spacious and beautiful. We stayed in a Jewel Spa Suite, and that too was beautiful - we particularly loved the large round spa bath set in an alcove of Bisazza (style?) tiles - delicious! Next stop we headed to the outdoor pool. Although close to the city, the feeling we got whilst we sipped our cocktails at the very attractive pool bar was that we had escaped to a resort for the weekend... we felt like we were on holiday, which is no mean feat for a city hotel. After spending the evening checking out a couple of the bars and restaurants in the Star complex we headed back to the room for some much needed relaxation. The only downside we could find is that there are no spa facilities available for hotel guests, unless you pay for a treatment. All in all The Darling lived up to the hype, and thoroughly deserves its Hot Pink rating on the neilsonparc Lust List.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, modern technology but be ready to pay”
Reviews.Author: themit
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my overnight stay at The Darling in a room called 'Darling'. Finding the carpark on arrival was easy enough, although be prepared to pay around $50 per day for parking unless you can earn free parking in the casino. Some sort of carparking deal when one is paying $300+ per night would be appreciated. From the carpark, The Darling was well signposted and we were soon greeted by a friendly team of staff. The staff of The Darling are a real asset, they were always willing to help and were very friendly. It is refreshing to see staff who are very genuine and helpful. The room was spacious enough for an entry level suite, and I personally liked the open plan style bathroom. The decor was very tasteful and the modern innovations took the room to the next level. The TV accepted all sorts of media including iPhone and iPad, and the room was easily controlled electronically using the TV or the buttons situated around the room. The shower with the rain-style head was enjoyable and so was the European wand, but it took a considerable amount of time to heat up to the desired temperature. The minibar was expensive ($18 for a small bag of cashews) and the automated pressure sensors which automatically bill your account upon removing items seemed over the top somewhat. The Nespresso machine in the room with complimentary pods was an outstanding feature as we could enjoy quality coffee at any time of day. We enjoyed breakfast at the Garden Buffet but it would be nice to see this included or discounted. We were above the pool and it sounded like an argument broke out during the night on the pool deck, but this is to be expected in a communal location. The promity to the gaming floor was great for those who like to see the action at any time of day, but some may not appreciate this. Under the fruit bowl we found some dirt and a black hair which indicates the cleanliness may be an issue, although the remainder of the room was spotless. Apart from a few minor things as above, I really enjoyed my stay here and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas night in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Pangari
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid week for a Las Vegas experience in Sydney. Very swanky hotel, modern urban chic. One of the best hotel pools in Sydney. Spacious rooms, everything controlled electronically and good decor. Attentive service from staff. Local cafes for an interesting breakfast. Will be back for another city break.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY STAY”
Reviews.Author: Greg Y
Reviews.Content: Booked a standard room at a spciel introductory rate. What a fantastic experience. All staff were polite, friendly and attentive. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite which was sensational. Too many features to mention all but luxuriously comfortable and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not just for Gamblers!”
Reviews.Author: countryweekender
Reviews.Content: You notice this hotel is different right from the moment you arrive at the front door and one of the helpful staff escort you right to the check in desk. They're obviously going for super-friendly Australian informal service, which we are quite happy with, as long as it remains efficient. Georgia on the front desk was certainly super-friendly, very chatty, but still remained quick and efficient. For some reason we were upgraded to a Jewel suite instead of the Darling room I originally booked, and what a pleasant surprise. On the 8th floor we had a great view of the pool which looks like it would be a real party venue if only the sun would shine. Absolutely loved the room - everything about it from the decor, the bathroom, the Molton Brown goodies, the Nespresso machine, the blackout blinds, the two teles, etc etc. I would highly recommend the hotel for parents who want to escape their children for the weekend (under 18's not allowed by the pool)... mind you none of the staff looked much over 18. As it was not busy (constant gloomy weather and rain), the staff had nothing to do but hang around and gossip and chat, and they are all so young and gorgeous it's like being in a nightclub. (note to management - tell them to keep their voices down when guests are trying to relax and read the paper - the odd very loud "shhhhhhhhh" from one of the older crew doesn't really do the trick!). Still, I don't want to complain too much as despite being very old and crusty (over 45), we really loved the cool and groovy atmosphere of the hotel - the interior decor is truly inspirational. Only thing that might concern some international guests is that there is no in house breakfast available other than room service, and their flagship restaurant is not open lunchtimes or Sunday nights. Bit unusual for a 5 star hotel. But being in Pyrmont there are lots of groovy eating options nearby, so not a huge problem. Stay here for the pool, proximity to Casino and Momofuku (although we were underwhelmed by our meal), and the up to the minute decor and great rooms. A+

Reviews.Title: “The Darling?”
Reviews.Author: Eccles777
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying at Sydney's newest five star hotel. I called The Darlings 1800 number to make our reservation and reserved a suite for our two night stay. On arrival our reservation could not be located and turned out to have been made for another hotel operated by the Star Casino. We were advised that The Darling was more expensive to their sister hotel with a suite being more than double our rate and were graciously offered a standard room at our booked rate. On checking later this rate was still some $50 a night more than the best internet rate for this room on these nights. The hotel is quite modern and although the staff are casually dressed the hotel has a business feel. The room amenities were very nice, however these rooms don't have a bath and although the space saving bathroom makes the room more spacious the lack of privacy could be an issue. Being so new there are some teething issues, tissue paper along the top of the door will stop the wind whistling. Not quite the romantic getaway we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “nice enough..weird bathroom lay out”
Reviews.Author: gino f
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is very nice. modern and functional. staff were excellent. my mother and i booked a twin room and on check in were taken to level 6. the room itself is nice enough..a little small but with all the mod cons. unfortuntely we realised the bathroom was totally open plan..as in stepping out of the shower and you are near the bed.. no privacy whatsoever. ok if its a romantic situation, but not with family. strange because a twin bed configuration room would mean you could be with some one like a friend or assosciate. anyway we asked for a privacy screen of some sort and reception said it wasnt possible due to oh&s concerns. i accept this, but what to do next? reception kindly offered a wheelchair friendly room which provided far more privacy. they handled the problem well. even concierge commented that this was the style of modern design for hotel rooms and can be problematic at times...if we had known this we would have booked elsewhere just to avoid the hassle. maybe the hotel should mention this ontheir website..other than this problem the darling is great....for couples..

Reviews.Title: “Darling - Lets have a night without the kids.”
Reviews.Author: Shane S
Reviews.Content: Combining our work Christmas party and a luxury night at the Darling, we were not let down nor disappointed. From the moment we entered, staff treated us like Barack Obama on a flying visit to Sydney. The room was simply luxurious and all controlled by the TV remote. Lighting, blinds, air conditioning were all at your finger tips. Be warned to order your 6 styles of pillows in advance as we had the least firmest available which did not assist our sleep that night . Only in the morning, did we find a menu detailing a smorgasbord of pillows that could be ordered from House Keeping. Be warned the assortment of goods to purchase are booby trapped electronically. Any items that are removed from the fridge to inspect are automatically debitted to your account . The expresso coffee machine provided, was well received whilst in our luxurious bath robes. We will be returning in March for a dinner and theatre show on our wedding anniversary in April.

Reviews.Title: “Darling was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravels
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here as we had tickets to Richard III. On check in we were given a smoking room (which we didn't ask for or want). Reception moved us to a non-smoking room after we complained. In the new room one of the lights over the bed flicked on at off. At turndown, housekeeping left an empty bottle of water beside the bed and although there were two of us registed in room, they only left out one set of slippers and the one (empty) bottle of water. The electrical panel over the desk actually came away from the wall when I tried to unplug my phone. Crap lighting in bathroom for make up application No free wi-fi provided, which at $600/night for a basic room should be included. Even though we were on the 11th floor the street noise was still considerable. We usually stay at the Shangri-la and regretted that we hadn't. For the same price we would have gotten a larger room, a view of the Harbour rather than rooftops and Executive level access. B

Reviews.Title: “WOW- 5 Star Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Tracy049
Reviews.Content: The Darling is part of The Star Casino in Sydney. From the time you drive in under the fairy light lit undercover parking to the time you check out you are treated as royality! This place is classy the room was elegant with its remote controlled blinds,a/c lighting etc.A king size bed with a choice of 12 pillows! Rain shower head :) The staff were fabulous and all this is actually linked to The Casino!!We celebrated our 22nd wedding anniversary with dinner at the Casino The meal was and staff were excellent.I found this room on Wotif. com the room was $1,500 a night I paid $350 .. Its location is fantastic near Great Resaurants,The Imax Theatre,The markets, Darling Harbour.What a great experience.WOW

Reviews.Title: “"true 5 star service"”
Reviews.Author: minx88
Reviews.Content: I would like to say a big thank-you to all the staff at this new hotel. We were made to feel special with the personal service they provided, could not fault anything, comfortable beds the room was high tech with gadgets all at the push of a button for your convenience. staff are there all the way and nothing was too much trouble and with a smile. Great to see the guests are put first again very reasonable rates also, breakfast in the garden buffet was of a large variety and yummy fresh juices and fruits or cooked if you choose. We used royal limousines highly recommended from this hotel great driver "paul". This place has to be visited by more hotel proprietors so to see how its done!! Congrats on your new Hotel" The Darling".

HotelInfo.Name: The Darling
HotelInfo.Address: The Star | 80 Pyrmont Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2009, Australia
